intro: Diplocoma, commonly known as the common hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plants typically have showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep red. They often grow as shrubs or small trees, with rough, hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature.
